description: A small, compact parrot with a brownish-grey head and back, a turquoise or blue belly, and bright yellow markings on the crown and the bend of the wing.
temperament: Known for being exceptionally quiet, gentle, and charming. They are not as demanding or high-energy as many other parrots, making them great companions for calmer households.
loudness: Quiet. Considered one of the quietest parrot species, they tend to chatter and whistle softly to themselves.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-green-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Quiet"><title>Quiet</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known for their talking ability. They may learn a few words, but their vocalizations are mostly a pleasant mix of soft chirps and whistles.
dietaryNeeds: A standard diet of good-quality pellets, fresh vegetables, and some fruit is sufficient. They enjoy a variety of foods.
healthPointers: Can live for 25-35 years. Can be prone to aspergillosis if their environment is not kept clean and dry. Otherwise, they are quite hardy.
housing: Excellent for apartments due to their quiet nature. A minimum cage size of 24"W x 18"D x 24"H is appropriate.
